head.title: Eun Hai Grace Park, Joseph Hong

hedline.hl1: Eun Hai Grace Park, Joseph Hong

block.p: Eun Hai Grace Park and Joseph Soon Jo Hong were married yesterday by the Rev. Young Ghil Lee, a Presbyterian minister, at the Korean Church of Boston in Brookline, Mass.

The bride, 31, will continue to use her name professionally. She is a law clerk to Judge Jacob Mishler of the United States District Court for the Eastern District of New York in Uniondale. She is a magna cum laude graduate of Dartmouth College and received a master's degree in East Asian studies from Harvard University and a second in public administration from Columbia. The bride also holds a law degree from the University of Pennsylvania. She is the daughter of Dr. Kee Choon Park of Brookline, a teacher at the Hennigan Elementary School in the Jamaica Plain section of Boston.
Eun Hai Grace Park and Joseph Soon Jo Hong were married yesterday by the Rev. Young Ghil Lee, a Presbyterian minister, at the Korean Church of Boston in Brookline, Mass.

The bride, 31, will continue to use her name professionally. She is a law clerk to Judge Jacob Mishler of the United States District Court for the Eastern District of New York in Uniondale. She is a magna cum laude graduate of Dartmouth College and received a master's degree in East Asian studies from Harvard University and a second in public administration from Columbia. The bride also holds a law degree from the University of Pennsylvania. She is the daughter of Dr. Kee Choon Park of Brookline, a teacher at the Hennigan Elementary School in the Jamaica Plain section of Boston.

The bridegroom, 34, is a senior technology officer at Chase Manhattan Bank in New York. He graduated from Princeton and received an M.B.A. from Penn. He is a son of Siok and John K. Hong of Pine Brook, N.J. The bridegroom's father is the president of Harding Enterprises, a clothing distribution company that also owns Anne French, a women's clothing line.
